item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, March 7, 2025 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Mistral OCR (1313 points | 363 comments)

3. 40% of Britons haven't read a single book in the last 12 months (7 points | discuss)
4. Differentiable Logic Cellular Automata (193 points | 37 comments)

9. Cargo (YC S23) Is Hiring ( | hide)
10. Anime fans stumbled upon a mathematical proof (352 points | 166 comments)

13. Show HN: Rust Vector and Quaternion Lib (87 points | 17 comments)
14. The British Navy Resisted a Decent Lightning Rod for Decades (23 points | 7 comments)

20. Rayhunter – Rust tool to detect cell site simulators on an orbic mobile hotspot (137 points | 12 comments)
21. Warewulf is a stateless and diskless container OS provisioning system (97 points | 30 comments)
22. Ask HN: How did the internet discover my subdomain? (74 points | 88 comments)
23. Show HN: Open-source, native audio turn detection model (71 points | 17 comments)
24. An equation of state for dense nuclear matter such as neutron stars (31 points | 14 comments)
25. Show HN: Shelgon: A Framework for Building Interactive REPL Shells in Rust (98 points | 19 comments)
26. InstantStyle: Free Lunch Towards Style-Preserving in Text-to-Image Generation (41 points | 11 comments)
27. Google Analytics Opt-Out Browser Add-On (16 points | 11 comments)
28. A brief meditation on formal systems and lying goblins (42 points | 12 comments)
29. Words for the Heart: A treasury of emotions from classical India (47 points | 9 comments)
30. Reintroductions of beavers into the wild in several parts of England (140 points | 108 comments)
